body.name: VA1KENE Cold Brew Coffee Maker 64oz - Iced Coffee Maker With Stainless Steel Filter, Mason Jar Pitcher With Lid and Spout (Black)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 7 hrs 18 mins
features: PREMIUM QUALITY GLASS KETTLE: This cold brew coffee maker is made of great quality food grade glass,the sturdy glass material is not easy to break.The glass jar and lid are free of lead,cadmium and BPA and have no unpleasant odor to affect the taste of your drink.Can be stored in the refrigerator and can be washed in the dishwasher

STAINLESS STEEL FILTER: 160 micron dutch weave cone-shaped metal mesh filter is made of great quality food grade 304 stainless steel with fine mesh,which can effectively prevent coffee grounds from entering the mason jar and make the iced coffee taste better.Also strains out tea leaves and fruit pits for easy iced tea and other beverages.

PREMIUM AIRTIGHTNESS: The 64oz cold brew pitcher pot comes with a silicone seal on the lid for premium airtightness, keeping your drinks fresh while also preventing leaks,even when the bottle is placed upside down or shaken.It's easy and convenient to open, pour and close,so you can store your drinks with confidence

SIMPLE AND CONVENIENT DESIGN: The iced coffee maker has a thickened ergonomic handle,which can hold the weight of a full pot,easy to hold or pour drinks.The spout design allows for easy pouring,easy control, and no spills on the table (the spout has a lid that stays in place so it doesn't wobble from side to side).

CONVENIENT CLEANING: Mason jar pitcher are very easy to clean.Just pour some cleaning agent into the glass jar and shake it to clean the cup easily.We also give a brush for cleaning the jar,which can be used to clean which can be used to clean the filter,If you use it for a long time and the residue is very stubborn,the design of the wide-mouth jar can also put your hands in the glass jar for cleaning

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Not particularly into cold brew, but in doing some research for coffee with lower acidity, I discovered that cold brew was key. So I cold brew my coffee, then each morning I microwave it to hot, throw it in my Contigo travel mug, and it is hot and delicious and not at all bitter all morning. I get 3 or 4 days' worth in each 64 oz brewing. I use cheap "Breakfast Blend" Aldi regular-ground coffee in the filter (maybe 8 tbsp), and I find it to be just fine. (I also don't use creamer.) I'm just adding all this info for those new to cold brewing and wondering, "How does this work? Do I need special coffee? Do I need to grind it myself?" NOPE! You can, but it's not necessary. Play around with it and figure out what works best for you. I love that it's glass, but that also means it's pretty heavy when it's full. I live in fear of dropping it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a great cold brewer
reviews.reviewText: NEVER PUT HOT WATER IN THIS JAR OR IT WILL LIKELY BREAK THE JAR. I have been making cold brew coffee for a month now. I am very happy with this and personally am glad that I don't have to purchase paper filters for it. I personally use 1.5 cups of Amazon's light roast coffee beans, which has more caffeine than darker roasts. I bought the Mueller brown colored grinder to grind the beans and grind to 14 course grind and it works great for cold brew. I put 64 oz of water in the jar, part of which I pour over the grounds. I get 48 oz of cold brew out of it. I answered a question if anyone needs instructions on how I do it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just like tik tok said.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Makes good coffee.
reviews.reviewText: I use this to make cold brew coffee. Very easy to use which is a good thing since it came with very limited instruction in very small print. No recommendations on how much coffee to use, so I just guessed at it. First batch was a little week so I increased the amount of coffee for the next brewing. Of course, this is all dependent on how you like your coffee. I prefer my coffee to be a little stronger than most people.Easy cleanup which is a plus.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I approved of this Cold Brew… Brewer 👍👍👍
reviews.reviewText: I initially was hesitant of purchasing this item being that it had no reviews at all. But now I’m glad that I went ahead and got one.The glass container is basically your typical thick mason jar with a wide opening. So if you have any concerns about whether the glass is thin or thick, just think of a Ball-brand mason jar.The filter is definitely sturdy and solid. I’m not exactly sure about the micron size of the filter’s holes but the best way I can describe the filter itself is that it is a double wall filter.So far, I have brewed 5 batches of cold brew coffee in this thing and each batch came out consistently fantastic.One very important note about the kind of ground coffee you use for this brewer. It is advisable that you at least utilize coffee beans that have been grounded to Medium ground. But I highly suggest that you utilize Coarse grounded coffee instead. By using either Medium or Coarse ground, the likelihood of having a small or tiny amount of coffee granules getting through the double walled filter is almost nil. I used Fine grounded coffee on the first two batches I made and did notice very fine coffee sediments/granules at the bottom of the jar. It wasn’t much but just enough that it was noticeable. This didn’t really bother me but I know for some this could be an issue.
